From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>

** Carnage smiled at Teltoli's comments on CyberClaw, chuckling as the rain 
continued to patter softly onto her scales. She may not like it, but she had 
a 10 7-year-olds view of the world. Everything seemed too new and eager to 
be explored. Mind so full of ideas that the imagination never ceased to 
amaze!
But even though others might enjoy her antics, Carnage wasn�t blind enough 
not to see that Teltoli really would rather be thought of as an adult.
But there was something she had to get straight, life wasn't a game and she 
had to buckle down and beat her brains out before she could take in what was 
needed to be like that. Carnage knew that for a fact. BUT.....she had 
learned the easy way and grew up like that, Teltoli was lucky and had grown 
up in a wealthy home.
Carnage sighed. There was a time she despised the wealthy and hated their 
guts, and would have never guessed that she would ever call one friend.
She sighed again...lucky twit! What she�d give to have grown up never having 
to worry about where you next meal was coming from.
Carnage smiled at the description Teltoli was giving of her mother.**
" Yeah. I bet if I knew who my mom was, she might have been the same 
way...or close to it."
** But then she listened to the words her father had spoken, reminding her 
slightly of her own horrid past.
Where blood had been something she had to grow fond of, even though it 
wasn't spilled by her own hands.
Carnage didn't like thinking about it, it was even worse then Dinobot's 
death. At least he had died in one piece!
She shivered for a moment, not sure if it was from the cold rain or the 
thoughts in her mind.
She had been very young when it all happened but she could remember almost 
everything. And it hadn't come back to her until now. Though she wished it 
wouldn't have.
Carnage had had a hard life, ever after her home had been destroyed and her 
father mutilated right in front of her eyes. But he never screamed. That was 
one things she remembered. He was brave to the end.
Carnage shook her head, relieving herself of the images, barely even hearing 
Teltoli finally talk about food.
Her voice was flat as if she was zoned out.** " Here there's no special 
additives, it's bound to taste different."
** Carnage shook her head again and looked at Teltoli.** " Can I ask you 
something...personal?" ** she cleared her throat.** " What it like to be 
loved? By family, I mean." ** she waited calmly, and she was really curious. 
She had never had a family to love her so she would like to know. Honest 
question. **
